items.title: Trump declares Venezuela's airspace closed
items.standfirst: President Trump intensified his pressure campaign on Venezuela on Saturday. He posted that the airspace around the country is "closed in its entirety." Weijia Jiang has more details.

items.title: Venezuela denounces ‘colonialist threat’ as Trump orders airspace closed
items.standfirst: President made declaration in a social media post, after FAA last week warned airlines of ‘worsening security situation’The Venezuelan government has responded defiantly to the heightened pressure by the US government, including Donald Trump’s recent statements on Saturday that the airspace above and surrounding Venezuela is to be closed in its entirety.In a statement, the Venezuelan government said Trump’s comments are a “colonialist threat” against their sovereignty and violate international law. The government also said it demanded respect for its airspace and would not accept foreign orders or threats. Continue reading...
items.content: President made declaration in a social media post, after FAA last week warned airlines of ‘worsening security situation’The Venezuelan government has responded defiantly to the heightened pressure by the US government, including Donald Trump’s recent statements on Saturday that the airspace above and surrounding Venezuela is to be closed in its entirety.In a statement, the Venezuelan government said Trump’s comments are a “colonialist threat” against their sovereignty and violate international law. The government also said it demanded respect for its airspace and would not accept foreign orders or threats. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Acclaimed playwright Tom Stoppard dies at 88

items.title: Acclaimed playwright Tom Stoppard dies at 88
items.standfirst: Acclaimed playwright Tom Stoppard has died at 88. Stoppard won the Oscar for his 1998 screenplay "Shakespeare in Love."
items.content: Acclaimed playwright Tom Stoppard has died at 88. Stoppard won the Oscar for his 1998 screenplay "Shakespeare in Love."

items.title: Playwright and "Shakespeare in Love" screenwriter Tom Stoppard dies at 88
items.standfirst: Stoppard was often hailed as the greatest British playwright of his generation.
items.content: Stoppard was often hailed as the greatest British playwright of his generation.

items.title: Sir Tom Stoppard, playwright famed for his wit and depth, dies at 88

items.content: The King and Queen pay tribute to a "dear friend who wore his genius lightly".

items.title: Tom Stoppard, playwright of dazzling wit and playful erudition, dies aged 88
items.standfirst: A theatrical sensation since the 1960s, whose dramas included Arcadia, The Real Thing and Leopoldstadt, Stoppard also had huge success as a screenwriterTom Stoppard: a life in picturesMichael Billington: ‘A brilliant dramatist who always raised the temperature of the room’The playwright Tom Stoppard, whose playful erudition dazzled the theatregoing world for decades, has died aged 88.On Saturday, United Agents said Stoppard died at home in Dorset, surrounded by his family. They paid tribute to the “brilliance and humanity” of his work and “his wit, his irreverence, his generosity of spirit and his profound love of the English language”. Continue reading...
items.content: A theatrical sensation since the 1960s, whose dramas included Arcadia, The Real Thing and Leopoldstadt, Stoppard also had huge success as a screenwriterTom Stoppard: a life in picturesMichael Billington: ‘A brilliant dramatist who always raised the temperature of the room’The playwright Tom Stoppard, whose playful erudition dazzled the theatregoing world for decades, has died aged 88.On Saturday, United Agents said Stoppard died at home in Dorset, surrounded by his family. They paid tribute to the “brilliance and humanity” of his work and “his wit, his irreverence, his generosity of spirit and his profound love of the English language”. Continue reading...

items.title: Tom Stoppard, Award-Winning Playwright, Dies at 88
items.standfirst: British playwright Tom Stoppard, widely regarded as one of the greatest dramatists of his generation, has died at age 88. His literary agency, United Agents, announced Saturday that Stoppard died peacefully at his home in Dorset, southern England, surrounded by family. The Czech-born writer won…
items.content: British playwright Tom Stoppard, widely regarded as one of the greatest dramatists of his generation, has died at age 88. His literary agency, United Agents, announced Saturday that Stoppard died peacefully at his home in Dorset, southern England, surrounded by family. The Czech-born writer won…

items.title: Tom Stoppard, celebrated British playwright, dies aged 88
items.standfirst: Stoppard's writing, often philosophical or scientific but consistently funny, gave rise to the term Stoppardian.
items.content: Stoppard's writing, often philosophical or scientific but consistently funny, gave rise to the term Stoppardian.

items.title: Acclaimed playwright Tom Stoppard dies at 88
items.standfirst: Tom Stoppard is remembered as a playwright whose wit and curiosity reshaped modern theater.
items.content: Arcadia, Rosencrantz and Guildenstern Are Dead and The Coast of Utopia. He's pictured above in London in 2017.'/>Tom Stoppard is remembered as a playwright whose wit and curiosity reshaped modern theater.(Image credit: Justin Tallis/WPA Pool)

items.title: Sir Tom Stoppard: Witty and playful writer who took ideas seriously
items.standfirst: He was an award-winning playwright whose works delighted generations.
items.content: He was an award-winning playwright whose works delighted generations.

ai_summary: Acclaimed playwright Tom Stoppard, known for his wit, died at the age of 88.
Stoppard won an Oscar for his screenplay "Shakespeare in Love" in 1998.
He was considered one of the greatest British playwrights of his generation.
His literary agency announced his peaceful death at home in Dorset.
Stoppard's writing style, often philosophical, gave rise to the term "Stoppardian."

items.content: Pope Leo toured the 17th-century mosque, but did not pray there.

items.title: Pope Leo pushes for peace and unity at Blue Mosque in Turkey
items.standfirst: Pope Leo celebrated mass in Istanbul with Turkey's Catholic community on Saturday. He also visited the famous Blue Mosque to address peace and unity across faiths. Chris Livesay has more.
items.content: Pope Leo celebrated mass in Istanbul with Turkey's Catholic community on Saturday. He also visited the famous Blue Mosque to address peace and unity across faiths. Chris Livesay has more.

items.title: Pope visits Istanbul’s Blue Mosque without praying as he focuses on Christian unity
items.standfirst: Pope Leo XIV visited Istanbul’s iconic Blue Mosque on Saturday but didn't stop to pray, as he focused more on bolstering ties with Orthodox patriarchs and promoting courageous steps for Eastern and Western churches to be united.
items.content: Pope Leo XIV visited Istanbul’s iconic Blue Mosque on Saturday but didn't stop to pray, as he focused more on bolstering ties with Orthodox patriarchs and promoting courageous steps for Eastern and Western churches to be united.

items.title: Pope Leo visits Blue Mosque in Turkiye’s Istanbul
items.standfirst: The pope is visiting Turkiye until Sunday on his first overseas trip as pontiff, which also includes a visit to Lebanon.
items.content: The pope is visiting Turkiye until Sunday on his first overseas trip as pontiff, which also includes a visit to Lebanon.

items.title: Pope Leo visits Istanbul's Blue Mosque
items.standfirst: It is the first time Leo has attended a Muslim place of worship since he took up the papacy in May.
items.content: It is the first time Leo has attended a Muslim place of worship since he took up the papacy in May.

items.title: Pope Leo tours Istanbul’s Blue Mosque during Turkiye trip

items.content: The Head of the Catholic Church, Pope Leo, visited Istanbul's Blue Mosque as part of his four-day trip to Turkiye.

items.title: Pope Leo visits Istanbul's Blue Mosque during first overseas visit

items.content: The Pope has visited Istanbul's Blue Mosque during a day spent meeting both Muslim and Christian leaders.

ai_summary: Pope Leo visited Istanbul's Blue Mosque during his trip to Turkey.
The Pope did not pray at the mosque, focusing on Christian unity.
He met with religious leaders to promote peace and unity across faiths.
This was the Pope's first overseas trip since taking the papacy in May.
The Pope's visit included a mass in Istanbul with the Catholic community.

items.title: Gaza death toll surpasses 70,000, says health ministry
items.standfirst: Two Palestinian children reportedly killed on Saturday as Israel continues its strikes after latest ceasefireThe Palestinian death toll has surpassed 70,000 since the Israel-Gaza war began, Gaza’s health ministry said on Saturday, while a hospital reported Israeli fire killed two Palestinian children in the territory’s south.The toll has continued to rise after the latest ceasefire took effect on 10 October. Israel still carries out strikes in response to what it has called violations of the truce, and bodies from earlier in the war are being recovered from the rubble. Continue reading...
items.content: Two Palestinian children reportedly killed on Saturday as Israel continues its strikes after latest ceasefireThe Palestinian death toll has surpassed 70,000 since the Israel-Gaza war began, Gaza’s health ministry said on Saturday, while a hospital reported Israeli fire killed two Palestinian children in the territory’s south.The toll has continued to rise after the latest ceasefire took effect on 10 October. Israel still carries out strikes in response to what it has called violations of the truce, and bodies from earlier in the war are being recovered from the rubble. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Three days of mourning begin after Hong Kong's deadliest fire in decades

items.title: Three days of mourning begin after Hong Kong's deadliest fire in decades
items.standfirst: At least 128 people have died and hundreds remain unaccounted for following the fire which engulfed several tower blocks.
items.content: At least 128 people have died and hundreds remain unaccounted for following the fire which engulfed several tower blocks.

items.title: Hong Kong begins three-day mourning period after deadly high-rise fire
items.standfirst: Hong Kong began a three-day mourning period, after at least 128 people were killed in fires at a high-rise complex.
items.content: Hong Kong began a three-day mourning period, after at least 128 people were killed in fires at a high-rise complex.

items.title: Hong Kong begins three days of mourning after deadly apartment fires
items.standfirst: Families are combing hospitals hoping to find their loved ones as about 200 people still listed as missing, and at least 128 killedAn outpouring of grief was set to sweep Hong Kong on Saturday as an official, three-day mourning period began with a moment of silence for the 128 people killed in one of the city’s deadliest fires.City leader John Lee, along with senior ministers and dozens of top civil servants, stood in silence for three minutes on Saturday morning outside the government headquarters, where the flags of China and Hong Kong were flown at half-mast. Continue reading...
items.content: Families are combing hospitals hoping to find their loved ones as about 200 people still listed as missing, and at least 128 killedAn outpouring of grief was set to sweep Hong Kong on Saturday as an official, three-day mourning period began with a moment of silence for the 128 people killed in one of the city’s deadliest fires.City leader John Lee, along with senior ministers and dozens of top civil servants, stood in silence for three minutes on Saturday morning outside the government headquarters, where the flags of China and Hong Kong were flown at half-mast. Continue reading...

items.title: Rescue efforts end at Hong Kong tower block fire as death toll reaches 128
items.standfirst: About 200 people still unaccounted for, say officials, as fire chief confirms no alarms went off in any of the eight towersAnger swells in Hong Kong over deadliest fire in more than 70 yearsHow the Hong Kong fire unfolded – visual guideThe death toll from the Hong Kong apartment complex fire that began on Wednesday has risen to 128 with as many as 200 missing, officials have said, as rescue operations were declared over.Firefighters had been combing through the high-rises on Friday, attempting to find anyone alive after the massive fire that spread to seven of eight towers in one of the city’s deadliest blazes. Continue reading...
items.content: About 200 people still unaccounted for, say officials, as fire chief confirms no alarms went off in any of the eight towersAnger swells in Hong Kong over deadliest fire in more than 70 yearsHow the Hong Kong fire unfolded – visual guideThe death toll from the Hong Kong apartment complex fire that began on Wednesday has risen to 128 with as many as 200 missing, officials have said, as rescue operations were declared over.Firefighters had been combing through the high-rises on Friday, attempting to find anyone alive after the massive fire that spread to seven of eight towers in one of the city’s deadliest blazes. items.title: Hong Kong fire death toll rises to 128, with 200 still missing and 8 more arrested
items.standfirst: HONG KONG — The inferno that tore through a high-rise housing estate in Hong Kong has killed at least 128 people, authorities said Friday, with some 200 people still missing and eight more arrested
items.content: HONG KONG — The inferno that tore through a high-rise housing estate in Hong Kong has killed at least 128 people, authorities said Friday, with some 200 people still missing and eight more arrested

items.title: Ukraine's naval drones strike Russian oil tankers in the Black Sea off the Turkish coast
Ukrainian naval drones strike two Russian oil tankers in Black Sea
items.standfirst: Kyiv tries to pile pressure on Russia with attack on empty vessels on way to load up with oil for foreign marketsUkrainian naval drones hit two tankers operating under sanctions in the Black Sea as they headed to a Russian port to load up with oil destined for foreign markets, an official said on Saturday, as Kyiv tries to pile pressure on Russia’s vast oil industry.The two oil tankers, identified as the Kairos and Virat, were empty and sailing to Novorossiysk, a major Russian Black Sea oil terminal, the official at the security service of Ukraine told Reuters. Continue reading...

items.title: Northwestern settles with Trump administration in $75M deal to regain federal funding
items.standfirst: The university will pay $75 million over three years to end the Trump administration's investigations into antisemitism on its campus and to have millions of dollars in federal funding restored.
items.content: The university will pay $75 million over three years to end the Trump administration's investigations into antisemitism on its campus and to have millions of dollars in federal funding restored.(Image credit: Teresa Crawford)

items.title: Northwestern University agrees to pay US government $75m to restore research funding
items.standfirst: Agreement will also end series of investigations of university over school’s alleged failure to fight antisemitismNorthwestern University has agreed to pay $75m to the US government in a deal with the Trump administration to end a series of investigations and restore hundreds of millions of dollars in federal research funding.Donald Trump’s administration had cut off $790m in grants in a standoff that contributed to university layoffs and the resignation in September of Northwestern’s president, Michael Schill. The administration argued the school had not done enough to fight antisemitism. Continue reading...
items.content: Agreement will also end series of investigations of university over school’s alleged failure to fight antisemitismNorthwestern University has agreed to pay $75m to the US government in a deal with the Trump administration to end a series of investigations and restore hundreds of millions of dollars in federal research funding.Donald Trump’s administration had cut off $790m in grants in a standoff that contributed to university layoffs and the resignation in September of Northwestern’s president, Michael Schill. The administration argued the school had not done enough to fight antisemitism. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Northwestern University will pay $75 million to the U.S. government.
The deal ends investigations into antisemitism on campus.
The agreement restores millions in federal research funding.
The Trump administration had cut off $790 million in grants.
The administration argued the school did not fight antisemitism enough.

items.title: Major winter storm impacts post-Thanksgiving travel for millions

items.content: Winter storm warnings and advisories extended from Montana to Ohio, the National Weather Service said. Forecasters warned there could be airport delays and slowed traffic with snow falling at more than an inch per hour in some areas.

clusters.title: Study Finds Tattoo Ink Accumulates In Lymph Nodes
clusters.neutral_headline: Study Finds Tattoo Ink Accumulates In Lymph Nodes

items.title: Study Finds Tattoo Ink Accumulates In Lymph Nodes
items.standfirst: Study Finds Tattoo Ink Accumulates In Lymph Nodes A new study shows tattoo ink drains into the lymphatic system and accumulates in lymph nodes, diminishing the effects of immune cells. This accumulation of ink pigment triggers both local and systemic inflammation that persists for months. A…
items.content: Study Finds Tattoo Ink Accumulates In Lymph Nodes A new study shows tattoo ink drains into the lymphatic system and accumulates in lymph nodes, diminishing the effects of immune cells. This accumulation of ink pigment triggers both local and systemic inflammation that persists for months. A…

items.title: Tattoo Ink Moves Through the Body, Killing Immune Cells and Weakening Vaccine Response
items.standfirst: Tattoo ink doesn’t just sit inertly in the skin. New research shows it moves rapidly into the lymphatic system, where it can persist for months, kill immune cells, and even disrupt how the body responds to vaccines.
items.content: Tattoo ink doesn’t just sit inertly in the skin. New research shows it moves rapidly into the lymphatic system, where it can persist for months, kill immune cells, and even disrupt how the body responds to vaccines.

ai_summary: Tattoo ink accumulates in lymph nodes, according to a new study.
The ink drains into the lymphatic system.
Ink accumulation diminishes the effects of immune cells.
The ink triggers local and systemic inflammation.
The inflammation persists for months.

items.title: Trump to pardon ex-Honduras president convicted of drug trafficking
items.standfirst: Juan Orlando Hernández was sentenced in the US to 45 years behind bars for conspiring to smuggle cocaine.
items.content: Juan Orlando Hernández was sentenced in the US to 45 years behind bars for conspiring to smuggle cocaine.

items.title: Trump to pardon ex-Honduras leader serving drug trafficking sentence in US
items.standfirst: Hernández was convicted in 2024 of accepting millions in bribes to protect cocaine shipmentsDonald Trump has said he will grant a pardon to Juan Orlando Hernández, the former president of Honduras who is serving a 45-year prison sentence in the US on drug trafficking and weapons charges.“I will be granting a Full and Complete Pardon to Former President Juan Orlando Hernandez who has been, according to many people that I greatly respect, treated very harshly and unfairly,” Trump said on Friday in a post on Truth Social. Continue reading...
items.content: Hernández was convicted in 2024 of accepting millions in bribes to protect cocaine shipmentsDonald Trump has said he will grant a pardon to Juan Orlando Hernández, the former president of Honduras who is serving a 45-year prison sentence in the US on drug trafficking and weapons charges.“I will be granting a Full and Complete Pardon to Former President Juan Orlando Hernandez who has been, according to many people that I greatly respect, treated very harshly and unfairly,” Trump said on Friday in a post on Truth Social. Continue reading...

items.title: Airbus Warns A320 Fleet Needs Software Fix After Incident
items.standfirst: Airbus SE cautioned that more than half of its active A320 jetliner family fleet will need a software fix after a recent incident involving a JetBlue Airways Corp. airliner revealed that “intense solar radiation” could corrupt data that helps maintain functioning flight controls.
items.content: Airbus SE cautioned that more than half of its active A320 jetliner family fleet will need a software fix after a recent incident involving a JetBlue Airways Corp. airliner revealed that “intense solar radiation” could corrupt data that helps maintain functioning flight controls.

clusters.title: At least 500 killed in south-east Asia floods and landslides
clusters.neutral_headline: Floods and Landslides Kill Hundreds in Southeast Asia

items.title: At least 500 killed in south-east Asia floods and landslides
items.standfirst: More than 350 people killed on Indonesia’s Sumatra island with 162 reported dead across ThailandThe death toll from devastating floods and landslides in south-east Asia reportedly climbed past 500 on Saturday as clean-up and search-and-rescue operations got under way in Indonesia, Thailand and Malaysia.Heavy monsoon rain overwhelmed swathes of the three countries this week, killing hundreds and leaving thousands stranded, many on rooftops awaiting rescue. Continue reading...

Continue reading...

clusters.title: Video shows Israeli forces shooting Palestinians dead moments after surrender
clusters.neutral_headline: Video Shows Israeli Forces Killing Palestinians After Surrender

items.title: Video shows Israeli forces shooting Palestinians dead moments after surrender
items.standfirst: Far-right minister defends killing of two men who appeared to have given themselves up, saying ‘terrorists must die’Video of an Israeli military raid in the West Bank shows soldiers summarily executing two Palestinians they had detained seconds earlier.The shooting on Thursday evening, which was also witnessed by journalists close to the scene, is under justice ministry review, but has already been defended by Israel’s far-right minister Itamar Ben-Gvir, who declared that “terrorists must die”. Continue reading...
items.content: Far-right minister defends killing of two men who appeared to have given themselves up, saying ‘terrorists must die’Video of an Israeli military raid in the West Bank shows soldiers summarily executing two Palestinians they had detained seconds earlier.The shooting on Thursday evening, which was also witnessed by journalists close to the scene, is under justice ministry review, but has already been defended by Israel’s far-right minister Itamar Ben-Gvir, who declared that “terrorists must die”. Continue reading...

items.title: Israeli forces kill two Palestinians after they appear to surrender
items.standfirst: Israeli security forces shot and killed two Palestinian men who appeared to be unarmed and surrendering in the occupied West Bank on Thursday, according to video filmed by Palestine TV that was distributed by Reuters, and video shot by the news agency itself
items.content: Israeli security forces shot and killed two Palestinian men who appeared to be unarmed and surrendering in the occupied West Bank on Thursday, according to video filmed by Palestine TV that was distributed by Reuters, and video shot by the news agency itself
